Articles.Content: Ok I have been playing this game for about four weeks and u have yet to discover what antennas or the "coms" that everyone mentions. Is it just for imaginary practice right now or is there an actually use for these
They don't do anything. They're just cosmetic. (yet)
they may serve a function in some distant future, but right now they're aesthetic. I think there's a mod that utilizes them as means of communications

In the stock game, they're only for decoration. But the RemoteTech mod gives them purpose, making unmanned probes usable only if they're able to communicate to a base station via satellite dish or antenna, with realistic signal delays. It's pretty fun.
O ok that was what I was thinking I Kay keep seeing everyone mentioning how they were using coms. People must have pretty good imaginations, lol
Hum ok so maybe people don't have to have a good imagination then
They have a use in theory, but are currently for looks. They make probes look the part eh? Realism...

Thread: Point of antennas and coms

I see what you did there...

I got no mods and i swear one of my wacky creations went somewhere around +200K away from Kerbin when i could no longer control it.

But when it got back closer to Kerbin i could control it once more. Extended an antenna and i didn't think about it anymore....
Haha I didn't even notice I did that.
I was skeptical of RemoteTech at first, but it really adds something great to the game!

Sounds like your solar panels weren't facing the sun and you ran out of juice until your orbited long enough for them to face the sun again.
For all of my satellites, I will always just put communication stuff on them. Makes them look more fancy.

There is the RemoteTech mod (and the associated compatibility patch to make the stock parts work with it), where you need to have line of sight with comm equipment on unmanned craft in order to control them. It even has realistic lightspeed delays.
